questions.question: Detect any anomalous revenue points across all categories, then resample the data to a weekly frequency to see if these anomalies are isolated events or part of a broader weekly pattern.

answer.value: The results confirm they are one-off events, completing the exploration.

key_insights: The most significant anomalies are the extreme revenue spikes for Electronics (3900 in April and 2400 in August) and Home Appliances (2600 in April).
Sports also has a notable anomaly in early January with a revenue of 1900, which is far above its typical range.
The weekly resampling shows that the April Electronics and Home Appliances spikes are isolated to a single week, confirming they are likely one-off events (e.g., a major sale).
The January Sports spike also appears as an isolated weekly peak.
The rest of the weekly data shows much more stable revenue, with no other weeks showing comparable levels of anomaly.

reasoning.reasoning: This is a crucial first step in the exploration, as it pinpoints the specific events that need further investigation.
This helps determine if the anomalies are part of a recurring weekly pattern or are truly isolated.
